content: woodland tales knitting pattern by amanda berry email fluffandfuzz@googlemail com website fluffandfuzz@weebly com notes introduction these cheery woodland animals make a fun crib mobile and include a squirrel racoon fox hedgehog toadstool acorn and leaves this pattern incorporates intarsia colour- work and the squirrel uses a loop stitch you will also need to cast on and off knit purl work increases and decreases and sew seams work flat all pieces are worked flat back and colours together every time you change to avoid forth on the single pointed knitting needles not in making holes the round the mobile is suspended on single crochet chains worked on the crochet hook one size the fox squirrel and racoon are 13cm tall the hedgehog is 8cm long and the toadstool is casting on use the long tail cast on unless 7cm tall otherwise instructed gauge 28 sts x 36 row for a 10cm x 10cm square pull through to cast off cut the yarn leaving at in stockinette stitch on 3 25mm needles don t least a 30cm tail thread the tail onto a darning worry about gauge for this pattern it is not critical needle and sew through the remaining sts on the knitting needle pull the sts off the knitting needle onto the yarn gather together tightly and secure stockinette stitch also known as stocking stitch purl the ws row and knit the rs row copyright © 2018 amanda berry this free pattern is
